node.title: BHP's COVID vaccine mandate at a NSW mine has been found unlawful. Will it have national implications?
node.alt: Coal loading infrastructure with the sun setting behind it
node.description: The Fair Work Commission says BHP's vaccine mandate at its Mt Arthur Coal mine was unlawful because workers weren't consulted properly, not because mandates are illegal.
node.content:
["The Fair Work Commission has ruled that a decision by BHP to make COVID-19 vaccinations mandatory at its Mt Arthur coal mine in the New South Wales Hunter Valley\u00a0was not \"lawful and reasonable\".", "However, the FWC's ruling does not mean vaccine mandates will now be illegal at other workplaces in Australia.", "Far from it.", "The FWC's ruling was based on a very specific point.", "It said BHP's decision to enforce the vaccination requirement at the Mt Arthur mine was not reasonable because it didn't consult its workers properly before it introduced\u00a0the mandate.", "It suggested if BHP followed a proper consultation process, the mandate may have been allowed.", "It said\u00a0Mt Arthur's owners could even be in a position to impose a vaccine mandate later this month if it consulted\u00a0its employees properly ahead of time.", "
What's the backstory?
", "In early October, Mt Arthur coal mine in New South Wales announced that all workers at the mine would have to be vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of site entry.", "The \"Site Access Requirement\" would compel employees to:", "It meant workers had\u00a0just over a month to get their first vaccine dose.", "Then, come November 10, about 80 employees at the mine were stood down because they couldn't provide proof of vaccination, but that number shrank to 50 the next day, as more employees came forward with vaccination certificates.", "The Construction, Forestry, Maritime, Mining and Energy Union (CFMMEU) represents over\u00a0700 employees at the mine.", "It made an application to the Fair Work Commission to determine if the vaccine\u00a0mandate was legal and reasonable.", "The FWC considered if the mandate was \"a lawful and reasonable direction\" for employees covered by the Mt Arthur Coal Enterprise Agreement 2019.", "What did it find?", "This week, the full bench of the FWC ruled the\u00a0mandate requirement was not lawful and reasonable.", "
What did the FWC say?
", "The dispute hangs on whether or not\u00a0the vaccine mandate was \"legal and reasonable\".", "BHP's vaccine mandate had to satisfy both requirements.", "And according to the FWC, the vaccine mandate was prima facie a lawful direction because:", "Therefore, it became a question of the reasonableness of BHP's vaccine mandate.", "And the FWC found there were many reasons why a site access requirement for the Mt Arthur coal mine would be reasonable. These included:", "However, the FWC ruled that the mine's owners had not consulted mine workers in a reasonable way before it introduced the mandate.", "It said if\u00a0the mine's owners had done so,\u00a0the above reasons \"would have provided a strong case in favour of a conclusion that the Site Access Requirement was a reasonable direction\".", "What does that mean?", "It means if workers had been properly consulted about the need for a vaccine mandate ahead of time, the mandate may have been legal and reasonable \u2014 and\u00a0therefore allowed.", "
Why weren't miners properly consulted?
", "The FWC found the owners of the Mt Arthur mine failed to properly consult workers in a number of ways.", "\"In our view, the employees were not given a genuine opportunity to express their views and to raise work health or safety issues, or to contribute to the decision-making process relating to the decision to introduce the Site Access Requirement,\" the FWC said.", "\"They were not provided with information relating to the reasons, rationale and data supporting the proposal, nor were they given a copy of the risk assessment or informed of the analysis that informed that assessment.", "\"In effect, the employees were only asked to comment on the ultimate question: should the Site Access Requirement be imposed?\"\u00a0", "The FWC said the mine's owners did not consult with employees as far as is reasonably practicable as required by Section 47 of the Work Health and Safety Act 2011.", "The WHS Act is based on the work health and safety model laws, which have been enacted in all jurisdictions except Victoria and Western Australia.", "The FWC said employees were consulted far more about the implementation of the vaccine mandate than they were about the reasons, rationale and data supporting the proposal to impose a mandate in the first place.", "\"There was no real explanation provided by [Mt Arthur's owners] as to why there was a markedly lower level of engagement during the assessment phase,\" the FWC found.", "
What does BHP say?
", "BHP says it is assessing the implications of the FWC's decision.", "And importantly, it notes the decision only relates to the Mt Arthur mine in New South Wales.", "BHP has different vaccine mandates on other mine projects around Australia, which match the laws in those jurisdictions, and those projects will not be affected by the FWC's decision.", "Therefore, BHP's other vaccine mandates will remain in place.", "", "
BHP website: COVID-19 Australia Vaccination Position, Frequently Asked Questions\u00a0(Last Updated: 2nd December 2021)(Source: BHP)
", "\"We note the decision from the Fair Work Commission, which acknowledges the risks presented by COVID-19 and has outlined that further consultation should occur,\" a BHP spokesperson said.", "\"The science is clear that vaccination saves lives. BHP supports widespread vaccination as the path forward for the Australian economy.", "\"We are assessing the implications of the decision and will work with the commission, our people, and union representatives to ensure our workplace remains as safe as possible for our people, their families and the community.\"", "
What do workplace experts say?
", "Workplace law expert Michael Tooma says the FWC's judgement is \"very important\".", "\"It shows what we have known for some time \u2014 that the Achilles heel to the mandatory vaccination programs that are being run is really this consultation point, and the full bench really focused in on consultation,\" he told the ABC.", "\"What's good about this is that we now have some clarity as to the minimum expectations in relation to a [vaccination] program and how that is to be rolled out \u2014 and we have a full bench decision and the full bench is not saying, 'You can't do this'.", "\"What they're saying is, 'You need to do it properly'.\"", "", "
